Funtion.Detail: Catalysis of the reaction: 3-methyl-2-oxobutanoate + acetyl-CoA + H(2)O = (2S)-2-isopropylmalate + CoA + H(+).
Interacting selectively and non-covalently with any metal ion.

Catalysis of the transfer of a group, e.g. a methyl group, glycosyl group, acyl group, phosphorus-containing, or other groups, from one compound (generally regarded as the donor) to another compound (generally regarded as the acceptor). Transferase is the systematic name for any enzyme of EC class 2.

BioProcess.Detail: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of amino acids, organic acids containing one or more amino substituents.
The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of amino acids containing a branched carbon skeleton, comprising isoleucine, leucine and valine.
BioProcess.Keyword: Branched chain family amino acid biosynthetic process

BioProcess.Detail: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of leucine, 2-amino-4-methylpentanoic acid.
